availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda Searcy. Father of James Searcy, Buenavista Searcy, Corvin Searcy, and Catherine Searcy. Owned eight enslaved persons in Jefferson County, Kentucky in 1850. Blacksmith in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 13.
Find A Grave, "Jefferson Searcy (September 10, 1811-October 22, 1878)," Memorial #47260479, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47260479 (accessed April 20, 2018).
